question: Which country houses "Gilgel Gibe III Dam"?
explanation: Gilgel Gibe III Dam is a roller-compacted concrete gravity dam constructed on the course of the Omo River in Ethiopia, opened in 2015. This dam, which is a part of Gibe cascades-a series of dams, is the third-largest hydroelectric plant in Africa. The main benefit of the dam will be electricity generation, which is expected to supply about half of its power to Ethiopia and also has the option to export power to Kenya, Sudan, and Djibouti.
